concise_definition: v. 卖出, 销售 (sell 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: To exchange goods or services for money; to complete a transaction in which ownership is transferred from the seller to the buyer.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以金钱交换商品或服务，完成所有权从卖方转移到买方的交易过程。
definitions.example_en: The store sold 500 units of the new smartphone in just one week.
definitions.example_cn: 这家商店在一周内就卖出了500部新款智能手机。

definitions.explanation_en: To persuade someone to accept or agree to something, often by using convincing arguments or pressure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过有说服力的论点或施加压力，使某人接受或同意某事。
definitions.example_en: He managed to sell his idea of remote work to the entire board.
definitions.example_cn: 他成功地说服了整个董事会接受远程办公的想法。

definitions.explanation_en: To be completely consumed, absorbed, or taken over by an emotion or activity; often used in the passive sense of being overwhelmed.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指被某种情绪或活动完全占据、吸引或吞噬，常用于被动语境，表示被深深吸引或沉浸。
definitions.example_en: She was sold on the idea of moving to the countryside after visiting her cousin.
definitions.example_cn: 她在拜访了表亲之后，完全被搬到乡下的想法吸引了。

comparison.analysis: “Sold out” (售罄) 是一个固定短语，强调某物的所有库存已被全部买走，不再有剩余，具有结果性含义。而 “sold” 仅表示销售行为的发生，不必然意味着全部售完。例如：The concert tickets sold quickly（门票卖得很快），但不一定 sold out（售罄）。
“Bought” (购买) 是 “buy” 的过去式，与 “sold” 构成交易的对立面。前者从买方视角描述行为，后者从卖方视角描述。两者常成对出现，但语义方向相反：‘I bought a book’ vs. ‘The bookstore sold me a book’。
“Promoted” (推广/促销) 指通过广告、营销等手段提高商品的知名度或吸引力，以促成销售，但本身不等于完成交易。而 “sold” 强调交易的实际完成。一个产品可以被大力推广（promoted）但仍未被卖出（not sold）。
